meanings.definition: The customary code of polite behavior in society.
meanings.sent1: Learning good etiquettes is important for making friends.
meanings.sent2: She always follows the etiquettes at the dinner table.
meanings.sent3: John forgot his etiquettes and accidentally bumped into the waiter.
meanings.sent4: Her impeccable etiquettes shone brightly at the formal event.
meanings.sent5: The etiquettes of a gentleman include holding the door for others.

meanings.definition: The rules governing socially acceptable behavior.
meanings.sent1: Breaking etiquettes can lead to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: The school has strict etiquettes regarding uniform and punctuality.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to have its own set of etiquettes when it came to sharing its toys.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, etiquettes can make or break a deal.
meanings.sent5: She taught her children the etiquettes of kindness and respect.
